title: Remembering Home Through the Lights
original:
“Kîsikâw pîsim kîwêwin kîsikohk nipîkiskwêyin.
Nitanis mâka nika kîsikâw nêhiyaw ᐊᐧᓯᐧᑲᐦᐃᑲᓂᕆᔭᐤ.
Kîsikâw nistam pîkiskwêwin mâna ayisiyiniwak ohci.”
translation:
“When the sky glows, I remember home.
Even in the city, I am still Cree.
The stories are the voice of our people.”

title: The Night the Northern Lights Danced
original: Tânisi — (Translated from Cree). That night, the sky was alive with dancing lights. My grandmother told us not to whistle, or the spirits would come closer. She said the northern lights were our ancestors playing a game across the sky, laughing in colors we could not name.
translation: Hello — That night, the sky shimmered with living light.  My grandmother warned us never to whistle, for the spirits might draw near.  She told us the northern lights were our ancestors dancing above,  playing their ancient games and laughing in colors the earth has forgotten to name
